guidelinesPage.title: Content Guidelines
guidelinesPage.description: Dialektli is a community for everyone, including you. Anybody can post a definition, but in order to keep things fun for everyone, we ask that you follow the following ground rules:

dos.title: Write for a large audience.
dos.description: When defining a word, make sure to provide enough context for other people to understand what it means and how it's typically used. Need a little help? Look to our Word of the Day for some examples.

dos.title: Be creative.
dos.description: Some of the best definitions on Dialektli find humorous ways to poke fun at authority, or put a clever twist on current events. Some of them are just straight up weird. We're okay with that.

dos.title: Have fun.
dos.description: We are not a traditional dictionary. This is a place where language has a little more space to be explored and constructed freely, in the moment.

donts.title: Don't post personal information.
donts.description: That includes obvious things like last names and addresses, but we will also remove definitions containing first names or user handles if they can be used to identify and target specific individuals for harassment.

donts.title: Don't be an asshole.
donts.description: We are okay with people defining offensive words. After all, people use offensive words in the real world and a resource for understanding what those words mean can be valuable. However, we are notâ€”and never will beâ€”okay with people using a definition to harass, discriminate, and/or directly incite violence against others.

term.author: Author
term.title: Expression
term.cantonFieldHelperText: Select the cantons this expression is associated with
term.descriptionFieldHelperText: <bold>Write for a large audience.</bold> Lots of people will read this, so give some background information.
term.examplesFieldHelperText: Provide examples of how this expression is used in context, or how it is used in a sentence. This will help others understand the expression better.

newTerm.title: New Expression
newTerm.description: All the definitions were written by people just like you. Now's your chance to add your own!

editTerm.title: Edit Expression
editTerm.notAuthorizedWarning: You are not authorized to edit this expression
editTerm.claimOwnership: If you contributed this exporession and would like to <0>Claim Ownership</0> over this exporession.
editTerm.claimOwnershipLinkHref: mailto:urbanswisstionary@gmail.com?subject=Claim ownership over '{{termTitle}}', id '{{termId}}'&body=Hi, I would like to claim ownership over '{{termTitle}}', id '{{termId}}' and here I provide proofs of my claim.

reviewGuidelines.pleaseReviewContentGuidelines: Please review our <0>Content Guidelines</0> before submitting your expression.

dos.title: Share definitions that other people will find meaningful

term.suggestSynonym: Expand our dictionary - suggest a synonym!

404Page.description: Oh no! The page you are looking for does not exist.

seo.title: Dialektli
seo.description: Dialektli is a community-run dictionary for Swiss slang and dialects. It is a place where language is given a little more space to be freely explored and constructed in the moment. Current (colloquial) Swiss German words, sayings, idioms, etc. are exchanged here.

bugReport.title: Bug Report Form
bugReport.subtitle: If you encounter a bug please do let us know by filling out the form below and we'll fix it as soon as possible.

bugDescription.label: Describe the bug
bugDescription.helperText: A clear and concise description of what the bug is.

reproductionSteps.label: Reproduction steps
reproductionSteps.helperText: What are the steps we can take to reproduce the bug
reproductionSteps.placeholder:
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Go to '...'

2. Click on '....'

3. Scroll down to '....'

4. See error

expectedBehavior.label: Expected behavior
expectedBehavior.helperText: A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

browserDetails.label: Browser details
browserDetails.helperText: Go to <0>whatismybrowser</0>. Click <1>Copy URL to Clipboard</1> and paste that URL here.

additionalContext.label: Additional context
additionalContext.helperText: Add any other context about the problem here.

bugReport.thankYou: Thank you for submitting a bug report!
